data.title: Justitia Officium Award
data.text:
Established in 1978 to mark the 100th anniversary of the College of Law, the Justitia Officium is the highest honor bestowed by the faculty.

The award is traditionally presented at Commencement in May. A panel bearing the names of recipients is displayed in the lobby at the College of Law.

The following are recipients of the Justitia Officium, 1978-present:

2024

Cathy "Cat" McConnell

Judge Joanna Tabit

2023

Paul T. Farrell

2022

Dr. Roslyn Clark Artis

Robert S. Whitehill
